verses.kjv: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!
verses.web: Woe to her who is rebellious and polluted, the oppressing city!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for the rebellious, corrupt city — the city that oppresses its own people!

verses.kjv: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the LORD; she drew not near to her God.
verses.web: She didn’t obey the voice. She didn’t receive correction. She didn’t trust in LORD. She didn’t draw near to her God.
verses.ct: She refused to listen. She rejected correction. She didn't trust in the LORD, and she wouldn't come close to her God.

verses.kjv: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.
verses.web: Her princes within her are roaring lions. Her judges are evening wolves. They leave nothing until the next day.
verses.ct: Her leaders are roaring lions. Her judges are wolves that hunt at dusk — they devour everything and leave nothing by morning.

verses.kjv: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.
verses.web: Her prophets are arrogant and treacherous people. Her priests have profaned the sanctuary. They have done violence to the law.
verses.ct: Her prophets are reckless and treacherous. Her priests have defiled the sanctuary and twisted the law to suit themselves.

verses.kjv: The just LORD is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.
verses.web: LORD, within her, is righteous. He will do no wrong. Every morning he brings his justice to light. He doesn’t fail, but the unjust know no shame.
verses.ct: Yet the LORD is right there in the city, and he is just. He does no wrong. Every morning he brings his justice to light without fail — but the wicked feel no shame at all.

verses.kjv: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.
verses.web: I have cut off nations. Their battlements are desolate. I have made their streets waste, so that no one passes by. Their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, so that there is no inhabitant.
verses.ct: "I have wiped out nations. Their fortresses are in ruins. I've made their streets empty, with no one walking through them. Their cities are destroyed — not a single person is left living in them.

verses.kjv: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.
verses.web: I said, “Just fear me. Receive correction, so that her dwelling won’t be cut off, according to all that I have appointed concerning her.” But they rose early and corrupted all their doings.
verses.ct: I thought, 'Surely now they will fear me. Surely they will accept correction.' Then their home wouldn't be torn down, no matter how I disciplined them. But instead, they got up early and made everything they did even more corrupt.

verses.kjv: Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the LORD, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.
verses.web: “Therefore wait for me”, says LORD, “until the day that I rise up to the prey, for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour on them my indignation, even all my fierce anger, for all the earth will be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.
verses.ct: So wait for me," declares the LORD, "until the day I rise up to seize the prey. I have decided to gather the nations and assemble the kingdoms so I can pour out my fury on them — all my fierce anger. The whole earth will be consumed by the fire of my jealousy.

verses.kjv: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the LORD, to serve him with one consent.
verses.web: For then I will purify the lips of the peoples, that they may all call on LORD’s name, to serve him shoulder to shoulder.
verses.ct: "But then I will give the peoples purified lips, so that all of them may call on the name of the LORD and serve him side by side.

verses.kjv: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.
verses.web: From beyond the rivers of Cush, my worshipers, even the daughter of my dispersed people, will bring my offering.
verses.ct: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia, my worshipers — my scattered people — will come and bring offerings to me.

verses.kjv: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.
verses.web: In that day you will not be disappointed for all your doings, in which you have transgressed against me; for then I will take away out from among you your proudly exulting ones, and you will no more be arrogant in my holy mountain.
verses.ct: On that day, you won't be ashamed of all the ways you sinned against me, because I will remove from among you those who are arrogant and boastful. You will never again be proud and defiant on my holy mountain.

verses.kjv: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the LORD.
verses.web: But I will leave among you an afflicted and poor people, and they will take refuge in LORD’s name.
verses.ct: I will leave among you a humble and lowly people, and they will trust in the name of the LORD.

verses.kjv: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
verses.web: The remnant of Israel will not do iniquity, nor speak lies, neither will a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth, for they will feed and lie down, and no one will make them afraid.”
verses.ct: The remnant of Israel will not do wrong or tell lies. No deceitful words will come from their mouths. They will eat and rest in peace, and no one will make them afraid."

verses.kjv: Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
verses.web: Sing, daughter of Zion! Shout, Israel! Be glad and rejoice with all your heart, daughter of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Sing out loud, daughter of Zion! Shout for joy, Israel! Celebrate with everything you have, daughter of Jerusalem!

verses.kjv: The LORD hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the LORD, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.
verses.web: LORD has taken away your judgments. He has thrown out your enemy. The King of Israel, LORD, is among you. You will not be afraid of evil any more.
verses.ct: The LORD has lifted your punishment and driven out your enemies. The King of Israel — the LORD himself — is right there among you. You will never face disaster again.

verses.kjv: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
verses.web: In that day, it will be said to Jerusalem, “Don’t be afraid, Zion. Don’t let your hands be weak.”
verses.ct: On that day, Jerusalem will be told, "Don't be afraid, Zion. Don't let your hands go limp with despair."

verses.kjv: The LORD thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
verses.web: LORD, your God, is among you, a mighty one who will save. He will rejoice over you with joy. He will calm you in his love. He will rejoice over you with singing.
verses.ct: The LORD your God is right there with you, and he is mighty enough to save. He will take great delight in you. He will quiet you with his love. He will sing over you with joy.

verses.kjv: I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden.
verses.web: I will remove those who grieve about the appointed feasts from you. They are a burden and a reproach to you.
verses.ct: "I will gather those among you who grieve because they can no longer celebrate the appointed feasts — those who carry the burden of that disgrace.

verses.kjv: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.
verses.web: Behold, at that time I will deal with all those who afflict you, and I will save those who are lame, and gather those who were driven away. I will give them praise and honor, whose shame has been in all the earth.
verses.ct: Watch — when that time comes, I will deal with everyone who has oppressed you. I will rescue the lame and bring back those who were scattered. I will turn their shame into praise and honor throughout the whole earth.

verses.kjv: At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the LORD.
verses.web: At that time I will bring you in, and at that time I will gather you; for I will give you honor and praise among all the peoples of the earth, when I restore your fortunes before your eyes, says LORD.
verses.ct: When that time comes, I will bring you home. I will gather you together, and I will give you honor and praise among every nation on earth — right before your eyes, as I restore everything you lost," declares the LORD.
